intro: Tulipa scabriscapa var. rebouliana, commonly known as the Rebouliana tulip, is a rare and distinctive variety of tulip native to Turkey. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant is characterized by its robust, upright growth habit and is often found in rocky, well-drained soils. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its limited distribution and conservation status, it is considered a species of concern in some regions.
